trans-unit.source: Ensures elements have alternate text or a role of none or presentation
Ensures a link name or linked image alt/title attribute does not equal a blacklisted word
The link name or the title/alt of a linked image equals a blacklisted word. Current Blacklist:
Ensures title attribute text is not the same as text or alternative text

The title attribute value is used to provide advisory information. It typically appears when the users hovers the mouse over an element. The advisory information presented should not be identical to or very similar to the element text or alternative text.
Ensures links with the same location have different names

For a keyboard user, it is tedious to navigate through redundant links. For users of assistive technologies, it can be confusing to encounter successive identical links. When the text alternative for the icon is a duplicate of the link text, it is repetitive as screen readers read the description twice.
Ensure headings are in a logical order.
Headings must be in a valid logical order, meaning <h1> through <h6> element tags must appear in a sequentially-descending order.
The database contains %s saved check results created by an automated check. It is advised to review the check results.
